p: CD8 + T cells can detect and kill virus-infected cells by recognizing viral protein-derived peptides (epitopes) presented by major histocompatibility complex class I (MHC-I) on the cell surface (Fig.Â 2A). While CD8 + T cell-based immunity does not prevent infection, it can facilitate viral clearance and reduce the severity of disease (McMichael et al. 1983; Sridhar et al. 2013).
